intro: Ozothamnus beckleri, commonly known as the silverleaf dandelion, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is a low-growing perennial shrub characterized by its silver-gray foliage and yellow composite flowers. The plant belongs to the family Asteraceae and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. It produces small, wind-dispersed seeds, which aid in its propagation across dry landscapes. Ozothamnus beckleri is often found in rocky soils and is resilient to drought conditions.
